website_summaries.verdict: Dual Thunderbolt 2 ports offer stunning versatility at speeds up to 20Gb per second.
pros: Combines past and present technology including FireWire, USB 3.0, USB 2.0, and eSATA storage ports
Dual Thunderbolt 2 outlets support daisy chaining additional devices and storage
cons: Some users found the dock to get too hot under prolonged use

customer_reviews.title: Nice dock!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality thunderbolt 2 dock. All ports work as they should. I am using various usb peripherals, a few Esata and USB3 drives. I also bought it for the Firewire port, as I have a bunch of older Firewire drives. Haven't tested the Firewire yet as those drives are in storage. The thunderbolt 2 port connects to my 2012 MacBook Pro without any problems and I have also used it successfully with my newer iMac and a thunderbolt 3>2 adapter. All in all I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David Osoff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for DJing
customer_reviews.text: The OWC Dock I had before this would do this really annoying thing where it would disconnect and reconnect really fast. I use the dock to support all of my hard drives while DJing but I can't have the hard drives disconnect in the middle of someone's wedding. Exchanged that dock twice and tried different laptops with same problem. This little guy is a life saver. It's smaller and so much more reliable than the others. 23 trouble free events since the purchase of this and I couldn't be happier. It also supports big 10TB external hard drives which is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit skeptical purchasing this for $200 -- but it gave new life to my 2011 iMac running High Sierra. Thunderbolt plugs into my iMac port, then daisy-chains two laCie drives, then on to a second monitor. The two USB 3.0 ports are each connected to a (powered) 4-port USB 3.0 hub, connected to a total of 7 USB 3.0 drives. And the two ESATA ports are connected to two legacy ESATA drives. Everything works great, wakes up properly after sleeping, fast and reliable. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SkiFar

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, great performance, no heat issues.
customer_reviews.text: Five days in and no issues at all. I've got monitor, hard drives, keyboard, camera, mouse, Firewire audio and Fitbit transceiver all running through the dock and no latency whatsoever. There have been a lot of mentions of excessive heat - I've seen none of that. Maybe I'm not abusing it enough. :) It's a well-built product, feels very high-quality compared to a lot of the cheap plastic USB hubs and other peripheral products I'm seeing. I'm digging it.
customer_reviews.author: Weave™

customer_reviews.title: Thunderbolt 2 to USB--YES!
customer_reviews.text: I needed more USB ports with power for my 2015 MacBook Pro and this hub has what it takes. It's nice and compact too.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Zerovnik

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, runs warm
customer_reviews.text: Firewire 800 and USB 3 ports have worked flawlessly for audio recording. (no data on others) I use the supplied Thunderbolt 2 cable, which connects to an Apple Thunderbolt 2 to 3 adapter, to a 2017 13" MacBook Pro. Very glad to have this as a Firewire solution for external RME Fireface devices.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It’s very solid. since this is powered by external source, it is better than having two thunderbolt 2 cable coming out of Mac, performance wise. (I just feel that way.) Downside will be.. Unit does heat up a lot. It is beyond hot. Burning hot. But nothing wrong with it. I put my USB fan next to it to let it cool.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick G.

customer_reviews.title: Akitio Thunder2 Dock "OK"
customer_reviews.text: Appeared to work fine for a single Thunderbolt 2 connection hooked up to a USB drive and a feed-through USB connection; NOTE: This device has a BIG wallwart and runs hot!
customer_reviews.author: Bonze Anne Rose Blayk AKA Rosie-Anne Quvus

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work fine. It keeps waking my Mac mini up when ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine. It keeps waking my Mac mini up when asleep. Had same issue with MacBook Pro. Not end of world but keeps me from using it as I had planned
customer_reviews.author: John Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly for my older iMac and a mix of old and new peripherals.
customer_reviews.author: Jauden

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Operates as advertised. Does run a bit warm as noted by others but poses no danger. Performance is exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Michalski Music

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Runs hot when it's being used, but it's working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Redman

customer_reviews.title: If it stayed mildly warm, or cool, to touch it would get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job as you would expect but gets EXTREMELY HOT!!
customer_reviews.author: cyclenerd

product_meta.title: AKiTiO 133363 Thunder2 Dock
feature_bullets: Two Thunderbolt 2 ports for lightning fast speeds up to 20Gb/s
One 7 watt bus-powered FireWire 800 host port
Two bus-powered USB 3.0 host ports (supports UASP)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars34 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
